title: pc building forums
body: hey off topic but does anyone know a good reliable forum for people wanting to find stuff about building their own pc. decided I'm going to do it and pretty noob about the whole think so i will need some help. cheers

yea quick question. i went to my local pc guy the other day to talk about the build and i told him i have a certain case (i win 805)  already in mind because the look is kinda important to me. and when i told him i have a budget of around 3000 he looked at me like i was crazy to go for a mid tower instead of full when i got that much. and he tried getting me onto the V71 core which is nice but i don't think its as sleek ass the 805. 
what my question is is it really a better idea to go a full tower instead? like i don't want to be having to change in a 2-3 years want something that will last

If your building around a budget of 3k yeah id find a nice looking full tower that you like.

Full towers have a better upgrade path so if down the line you want to do i dunno multi gpus or install every harddrive you own in the thing you wont need a new case.

That's not to say you cant buy mid tower, itl work just fine if you dont plan on doing major upgrades like that.

personally i say go with the iwin, itl serve you well.

there are plenty on these forums im sure that either know hardware or have built their own systems, or both. I've built several of my own systems before i'd be happy to lend my experience via the digital means.
Having said that, when I had the odd head scratching issue or general inquiry, i always turned to OCAU (http://forums.overclockers.com.au/).
From the simplest of questions to the very technical deep end, if you cant find the answer here you dont belong near a computer xD
